alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 8:17PM MST until August 20 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 813 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms and showers had moved out of the area. Thunderstorms earlier this afternoon had produced heavy rain from Skull Valley to Kirkland. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain fell. Although rain has ended, flash flooding remains a risk this evening near low water crossings, washes, and creeks. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kirkland. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 286 and 291. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Copper Basin Wash, Kirkland Creek, Sheppard Wash and Skull Valley Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
